name: funnel web
desc: medium to large in size, with body lengths ranging from 1 to 5 cm (0.4 to 2.0 in). They have a hairless carapace covering the front part of the body. They like to live in cool, moist, sheltered places such as under rocks and in rough-barked trees.
venom: One of the world's most deadly spiders. It causes great pain at the site of the bite, followed by nausea and abdominal pain. There's also difficulty in breathingand a general weakness or numbness of the muscles. The body secretes heavily in several areas. Profuse sweating is usually obvious, along with excessive saliva production. Heavy coughing is also common.
bitten: Call 000. Antivenom exists. In the men time, keep calm and don't move. A pressure immobilising bandage needs to be firmly applied around the whole limb. If possible, splint the limb and apply a second bandage.
